title: Son of dictator poised for the presidency as the Philippines goes to the polls
description: Six years after losing the race for vice president, the son of Philippines' dictator Ferdinand Marcos is taking on his old rival Leni Robredo -- and this time they're both aiming for the presidency.

title: Irish CNN reporter sees how hometown is helping Ukrainian refugees
description: CNN's Donie O'Sullivan returns to his home town of Cahersiveen, Ireland, and speaks to Ukrainian refugees who have been welcomed to an Irish school.

title: US intelligence-sharing with Ukraine raises a serious question: How far is too far?
description: Two months into Russia's war in Ukraine, the Biden administration has increased the amount of intelligence it shares with Kyiv, contributing to successful strikes against senior Russian leaders and the Russian Navy's flagship, the Moskva, sources familiar with the intelligence sharing tell CNN.

title: Car found in search for missing Alabama inmate and corrections officer
description: While investigators sift through hundreds of tips on the whereabouts of a fugitive Alabama inmate and the officer he escaped with, authorities have released new information that may help the public identify them.

title: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene shouldn't be disqualified over Jan. 6, judge recommends
description: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, the conspiracy-peddling Georgia Republican, shouldn't be disqualified over her role in the January 6 insurrection, a judge said Friday in a significant legal blow to the voters and advocacy groups who tried to throw her off the ballot.

title: Children get long Covid, too, and it can show up in unexpected ways
description: November 10 is a day Kim Ford remembers too well. It was the day last year when her 9-year-old son, Jack, was scheduled to get his Covid-19 vaccine at the school clinic. They were excited that he'd finally have some protection, but on November 9, he had the sniffles.

title: At least 9 dead after explosion destroys Havana hotel
description: • Latest: Search for survivors continues

title: With an unprecedented leak, Roberts appears suddenly ineffectual
description: The chief justice of the United States is only as powerful as the individual who wears the title and his times.

title: Watch: New footage from the 'Game of Thrones' prequel 'House of the Dragon'
description: HBO released its latest trailer for the Game of Thrones prequel "House of the Dragon." The teaser contains new footage of the hotly-anticipated series.

title: Wall Street is fed up with Under Armour, Nike and Adidas
description: Tripped-up supply chains and a coronavirus surge in China are causing headaches for top athletic brands.

title: Peter Thiel plans to wind down his involvement in 2022 after Vance's victory in Ohio
description: Billionaire tech mogul Peter Thiel won big when his longtime friend J.D. Vance succeeded in Tuesday's Ohio Senate GOP primary, surging to victory in the final days of the race after a last-minute endorsement from former President Donald Trump and a seven-figure boost from Thiel.

title: Colorado man speaks out after his trial in wife's disappearance was scrapped: 'I just want her to be found'
description: The Colorado man whose trial over the disappearance and death of his wife was dismissed has spoken out in his first public interview since the charges were dropped.

title: Former defense secretary says Trump proposed bombing Mexico
description: In his new book, former Defense Secretary Mark Esper says then-President Donald Trump proposed launching missiles into Mexico to destroy the drug labs in 2020. CNN political analyst Maggie Haberman has more.

title: Harry, Meghan and Andrew not invited to Queen's jubilee balcony appearance
description: Plans have been announced for Queen Elizabeth II's highly anticipated Platinum Jubilee weekend next month.

title: Pence to Harris: 'How dare you?'
description: Former Vice President Mike Pence responds to Vice President Kamala Harris' criticism of GOP lawmakers for their role in potentially overturning Roe v. Wade.

title: Ukrainian startup is bringing school to displaced students
description: Russia's continuing assault in Ukraine has devastated the country and the lives of millions of its citizens. The youngest among them — Ukraine's children — have been robbed of the ability to attend school and learn in a classroom, sitting next to their peers and friends.

title: Palestinians vow to stay on West Bank land despite defeat in decades-old legal battle
description: The leader of a Palestinian village council in the West Bank vowed Friday to continue fighting eviction from land the Israeli military is claiming as a firing range, despite an Israeli Supreme Court decision against the Palestinians in a case that has been in court for more than two decades.

title: Asian markets tumble as China remains fully committed to zero-Covid policy
description: Asian stock markets and currencies fell Friday, as investors remain worried about the US Federal Reserve's policy changes and China's renewed pledge to stick to its controversial zero-Covid policy.

title: Rafael Nadal says injuries leave him in pain 'every single day'
description: An interaction with a reporter laid bare the toll a 21-year career has taken on Rafael Nadal's body, as the Spanish tennis star said he endures pain "every single day."

title: Putin's reputed girlfriend Alina Kabaeva included in proposed EU sanctions list, sources say
description: Alina Kabaeva, a woman who has previously been romantically linked to Russian President Vladimir Putin, is included in the sixth proposed package of European Union sanctions against Russia over its invasion of Ukraine, according to two European diplomatic sources.

title: Amber Heard recounts explosive fights with Depp in defamation trial
description: Amber Heard took the stand again on Thursday, further detailing the alleged physical and sexual abuse she suffered from ex-husband Johnny Depp in the $50 million defamation trial.

title: Defending champion Max Verstappen just wants to 'win more' this season
description: Last year, following a season-long duel that ended with himself and Lewis Hamilton level on points ahead of the final Grand Prix, Max Verstappen was crowned world champion in Abu Dhabi in the most dramatic of circumstances.

title: Zeus, a Great Dane from Texas, is the world's tallest dog
description: A Great Dane has been crowned the world's tallest living dog by Guinness World Records.

title: Belarus jails student a year after forcing down the airliner she was traveling on
description: Sofia Sapega, a Russian law student arrested with her Belarusian dissident boyfriend last year when Belarus forced a Ryanair airliner to land, was sentenced Friday to six years in prison for inciting social hatred, Russian state news agency TASS reports.

title: Kim Cattrall has moved on from 'Sex and the City' and is doing just fine
description: Kim Cattrall has moved on from her days in "Sex in the City," but Samantha Jones is still with her.

title: Golf on safari: animals roam the greens at Africa's only PGA-accredited course
description: The hole six feet ahead of him, a golfer lines up his putt. Six feet behind him, a giraffe strolls idly by.

title: Listen to eerie sounds from echoing black holes
description: Millions of elusive black holes hide in plain sight across the Milky Way galaxy, only giving away their presence occasionally through bursts of X-ray light when they feed on stars.

title: Why the airport 100ml rule could end soon
description: A quiet revolution is underway in how we transit airport security -- but most of us won't even have noticed.

title: 'Doctor Strange' enters the multiverse, in what might be the most insanely Marvel movie yet
description: "Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness" might be the most insanely Marvel movie ever, for good and ill. Unleashing the infinite possibilities of the multiverse throws open the studio's toy chest, but the anything-goes aspects of that can be alternately thrilling, disorienting and occasionally, a little silly. All told, this sequel proves highly entertaining, if not quite worthy of the pent-up demand for it.

title: Tornado rips through elementary school in Kansas
description: The tornado that hit the Wichita, Kansas area on April 29 left the building unusable for the remainder of the school year.

title: Reporter asks prosecutor about new reported evidence in McCann case
description: Fifteen years after Madeleine McCann went missing, a German prosecutor is speaking out about a possible suspect. CNN's Randi Kaye reports.

title: Who profits from our humiliation? Cathy O'Neil sheds new light on what she calls 'weaponized' shame
description: Shame has existed since the first humans walked the Earth, according to mathematician and journalist Cathy O'Neil. But lately its evolutionary function -- to encourage pro-social behavior by enforcing norms that help sustain societies -- has been hijacked by parties seeking profit and power, O'Neil contends.

title: Why US politicians are trying to break the world's oil cartel now
description: A decades-old, failed effort by United States politicians to break the chokehold of a select few countries on the oil market has found new life as the war in Ukraine raised prices to an almost 14-year high.

title: What happens when the Russians capture men in Ukraine?
description: There have been numerous reports of Russian soldiers abducting Ukrainian men. CNN's Sara Sidner speaks with the families looking for answers.

title: 2022 Kentucky Derby: Everything you need to know about the 'Greatest Two Minutes in Sports'
description: The 148th edition of the Kentucky Derby is set to take place on Saturday as the iconic race looks to move on from last year's controversy.

title: Solar energy projects are grinding to a halt in the US amid investigation into parts from China
description: The solar energy industry has been thrown into a panic and projects are grinding to a halt after the Biden administration launched an investigation that some solar CEOs worry could tank the industry.

title: Video shows rescue workers pulling citizens out of collapsed building
description: Chinese officials ended the search for survivors in a building that collapsed 10 days ago in Hunan province. The incident resulted in 53 deaths.

title: Did you forget how to dress for work during the pandemic? Here's a guide
description: If the thought of retiring your comfortable sweats and choosing a new outfit to leave the house in each morning is an intimidating prospect, you're in good company. For the better part of the pandemic, I've lived in a pair of stretchy, soft wool trousers in the cooler months, switching allegiance in summer to a white linen dress that my brother-in-law dubbed "the ghost dress" (likening its so flowy, so oversized shape to that of a large bedsheet with a hole cut out for my head).

title: Man arrested after rampage at Bangkok airport
description: A man who allegedly went on an armed rampage at Thailand's biggest airport is now facing charges, one of which could be eligible for the death penalty.

title: 'It was so dark': Tennis star Nick Kyrgios opens up on mental health struggles
description: Tennis star Nick Kyrgios has opened about the mental health issues that he has battled throughout his career, saying he struggled with drug and alcohol abuse and also self-harm.

title: Shipping delays are back as China's lockdowns ripple around the world
description: Global shipping was just starting to recover from the chaos of the pandemic. Now port congestion and delays are back and could be around for a while.

title: WNBA regular season to start without Brittney Griner, who's still in Russian custody
description: The WNBA's 26th regular season starts Friday without one of the league's most exciting players, Phoenix Mercury center Brittney Griner, who remains detained in Russia.

title: Xi Jinping sends warning to anyone who questions China's zero-Covid policy
description: China's top leader Xi Jinping has issued the strongest warning yet against anyone who questions the country's zero-Covid policy, as stringent, frequent lockdowns fuel public discontent and deal a devastating blow to the Chinese economy.

title: One of Asia's most beautiful roads has reopened
description: Taiwan's Southern Cross-Island Highway has reopened to the public following a 13-year closure.

title: Late Miss USA's mother speaks out on daughter's tragic battle with depression
description: Cheslie Kryst, Miss USA 2019 and "Extra" correspondent, died at age 30. During an episode of Red Table Talk, Kryst's mother stressed the importance of mental health.

title: See priest's reaction when 7-year-old chugs first communion wine
description: A 7-year old chugging wine at her first communion cracks up the congregation. Jeanne Moos has the video gone viral.

title: 200+ sailors moved off carrier after multiple suicides
description: Over 200 sailors have moved off the USS George Washington aircraft carrier after multiple deaths by suicide among the crew, including three in less than one week in April, according to the Navy. CNN's Oren Liebermann reports.

title: Let's set the record straight on Lavrov's Hitler comments
description: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov's comments on Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky's Jewish identity have occasioned shock, dismay, and outrage. In an interview on Italian television, Lavrov defended his country's portrayal of Ukraine as a "Nazi" state, Zelensky's background notwithstanding. "So what if Zelensky is Jewish?" he asked. "The fact does not negate the Nazi elements in Ukraine." Indeed, Hitler himself had "Jewish blood," and "the most ardent antisemites are usually Jews," he said.
